comments.body: is the remove order really non-deterministic? that's surprising to me

@liggitt while we are cleaning the log files, we call `FakeOS.Glob` to get the paths of log files https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/14a11060a0775ed609f0810898ebdbe737c59441/pkg/kubelet/logs/container_log_manager.go#L196, which would iterate `FakeOS.Files` https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/14a11060a0775ed609f0810898ebdbe737c59441/pkg/kubelet/container/testing/os.go#L123-L127, and `FakeOS.Files` is a map https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/14a11060a0775ed609f0810898ebdbe737c59441/pkg/kubelet/container/testing/os.go#L36, so the order is non-deterministic after #93333.
What is the following `expectedConfig` used for?

Probably can be removed. @feiskyer 
But I don't want to turn this into a test cleanup PR. That can be done in a separate PR.

Missing one assertion

```
	assert.Equal(t, expectedConfig, containerConfig, "generate container config for kubelet runtime v1.")
```
